tldr: The author discusses the psychological aspects of war and how the mental strength of democracies can be a decisive factor in conflicts. He argues that freedom of thought, liberty of opinion, and honesty are not only moral values but also sources of strength. The author also criticizes the limitations of authoritarian systems and their impact on mental aptitudes, highlighting the importance of independent and critical thinking in wartime.
